title: TW Ferm Co. 2014 Cultivator Red (Paso Robles)
description: This small-production wine (just 22 cases) is a blend of 53% Malbec, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot that spent 32 months in 35% new French oak. Aromas of caramel, chocolate cake and black cherry are cut by a minty lift. The palate shows similar weight and richness, with flavors of baked strawberry, cinnamon and caramel sauce. It's soft on the palate and chalky in texture, boasting a  butterscotch finish.

title: Villa Creek 2015 Garnacha (Paso Robles)
description: Red and purple flowers meet with crushed slate, turned soil and plump cherry fruits on the nose of this bottling. It's a solid, down-the-middle expression of the grape, with red and black plums, clove and tarragon lifts to the palate.

title: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2016 Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefberg Old Vines Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate hints of clay and crushed earth lend savory complexity to this otherwise wildly fruity spätlese. It's unctuously ripe offering loads of summery peach and nectarine flavors but balanced by a spine tingling lemon-lime finish. Drink now through 2025.
designation: Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Josefberg Old Vines Spätlese

title: Wrath 2015 Alta Loma Vineyard Grenache (Monterey)
description: Rounded and ripe aromas of baked strawberry, red plum, dried rose petal and anise show on the nose of this bottling by theater tech-turned-winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The complex texture is still a bit stiff and sticky on the palate, and the flavors are strong and straightforward, with cranberry and sandalwood. It's clean and refreshing overall, but it could use more time.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Dhroner Hofberger Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Savory tones of smoke and crushed earth permeate from nose to finish, suggesting a complex auslese that's more mineral than fruit. Still, vibrant lemon-lime acidity and silken streaks of honey penetrate the midpalate and extend through a long, invigorating finish. It drinks well now but should show even better from 2021.

title: Domaine Weinbach 2016 Réserve Clos des Capucins Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose offers a hint of pear and a touch of lemon. These tones are reflected on the slender, dry palate, with concentration and ample fruit at the core. A lovely, light-bodied and elegant wine with a lasting finish.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Upon first whiff, there's more earth than fruit here, but aeration reveals a surprising bounty of tropical fruit on the palate. Light footed and medium sweet in style, its chock full of honeyed mango, pineapple and citrus flavors juxtaposed by zesty lime acidity. The finish is moderately long, tinged by struck slate and smoke.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Erdener Treppchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Intensely chalky, smoky mineral tones penetrate through bracing white grapefruit and tangerine in this delicately sweet kabinett. Spine tingling lemon-lime acidity captivates the midpalate and leads a long, thrilling citrus finish. It's delightful now but should continue to improve through at least 2021 and hold far longer.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Ürziger Würzgarten Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Ripe, rich tangerine, apricot and peach pulsate through this light-bodied yet powerfully fruity spätlese. It's unctuously concentrated yet balanced by spine tingling acidity and a murmur of lime zest on the finish. Delightful already but likely to improve further through at least 2030.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exuberantly fresh white peach and grapefruit flavors are cut by streaks of lime in this concentrated, juicy kabinett. Lip smackingly sweet and tart, it offsets its forward, fruity facade with a core of bracing minerality. The finish is marked by lingering slate and smoke tones.

title: Efeste 2014 Oldfield Estate Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: This is the winery's first red release from this site, located next to famed Boushey Vineyard. Aromas of iron, bacon fat, brown spice and herb rise up from the glass. The palate bursts with red-fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of intensity, depth and length. It's a promising start for this site.

title: Eikendal 2015 Pinotage (Stellenbosch)
description: A superbly balanced selection, this opens with tight, slightly reserved notes of blackberry, plum and boysenberry that are graced with earthy hints of tobacco leaf, licorice and sweet-cured meat. The palate is rich and tasty, yet kept in check by ample, bright acidity and structured tannins. The evolving finish leaves you wanting more. Drink now–2023.

title: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A hint of underripe cherry is all the nose gives away right now, but the palate opens into pure Morello notes. The body is poised and tart, fresh and vivid, with a lovely little crunch. This is light and crisp—ideal for those who love Pinot Noirs with an aromatic, light touch.

title: Handpicked 2016 Version Chardonnay (Victoria)
description: This brand, which employs an army of winemakers from around the world to make dozens of wines under the Handpicked label, has succeeded in crafting a delicious, delicate Chard at an affordable price. Attractive notes of red apple peels and blossoms are backed by a hint of baking spice and a copper penny tang. The palate is light and fresh, with a tight, chalky texture and a long ginger and apple-peel finish. One to sip with salads and seafood.

title: Hayotzer 2014 Genesis Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)
description: Deep garnet in the glass, this wine has a nose of black cherry, blackberry and violet. Tannins are soft at first and then build slowly, enveloped in flavors of black currant, cherry, vanilla, clove and white pepper. The lush mouthfeel diminishes just as the bright finish draws to a close.

title: Henschke 2015 Giles Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This is a lean style and still a baby with its sappy red strawberry and raspberry notes, with cinnamon, tar, violets, warm stones and furniture polish. The palate is tightly wound, ending on a long, tart cranberry and raspberry finish. Drink now if you like your Pinot al dente, otherwise cellar through 2025.

title: Howard Park 2014 Miamup Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: This wine is dusty and a little austere but is unmistakably Margaret River. Aromas of cedar, pencil lead, blackberry, baking spices and cocoa powder are followed by a drying palate wrapped in savory tannins. The fruit is slightly lost here, and things are still on the lean and mean side, but this should behave a little more generously with time in the cellar. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Il Macchione 2011 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Pressed iris, plum cake and camphor aromas take center stage on this approachable red. The round chewy palate offers fleshy black cherry, blackberry jam and cinnamon alongside relaxed smooth tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the juicy fruit.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 3400 Premium Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: Inky garnet in color, this wine has a bouquet of black cherry, cranberry and toffee. It is bright on entry, followed by chewy tannins and flavors of cherry, blackberry, espresso bean and chocolate. A quick splash of pomegranate brightens the enduring finish.

title: Johannishof 2016 Rüdesheimer Ramstein Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Succulent yellow-peach, grapefruit and melon aromas on the nose are contrasted by bracing hits of lime and lemon on the palate of this dry Riesling. While dancingly light on its feet, it's penetrating through a long, mineral-focused finish.

title: Keermont 2015 Riverside Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Delicate scents of white melon, orange rind, pressed wild flowers, quinine and barely-toasted apple skin dance in the bouquet of this attractive wine. Clean, precise flavors of apple flesh, Anjou pear and lime unfold on the medium-weight palate, while vibrant acidity enlivens the mouthfeel and results in a bright, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Vintner's Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: Lushly ripe pear and butter flavors are backed by vibrant, lemony acidity in this wine. It has good depth, medium body and a creamy texture, but stays balanced and fresh on the palate, leading to a lingering finish. Another outstanding vintage for a classic California wine.

title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 L'Un dans l'Autre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine is a selection from three parcels fermented and aged in barrel. Despite this generous use of wood, the wine is just as much about the bright, ripe fruit of the vintage. Spice, black-currant flavor and concentration give a wine that deserves to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Los Frailes 2014 G-11 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)
description: Prune and spice-cake aromas suggest a richly roasted wine. A massive palate with saturated weight and density delivers blackberry, chocolaty oak and pepper flavors in front of a finish that's a bit fiery. Drink this power-packed Valencian Cabernet through 2022.

title: Momento 2015 Grenache (Swartland)
description: A lovely note of mint chocolate rides atop the core of ripe wild berries and cherry in the nose and mouth of this attractive wine. It boasts a medium body and satiny texture, with ample structure and acidity for overall balance. The fruit-forward palate is accented by herbal, earthy hints, finishing with a flourish of baking spice. Drink now–2023.

title: Niepoort 2015 Conciso Branco White (Dão)
description: Produced from the Quinta da Lomba vineyard, this blend of Bical, Encruzado and Malvasia is ripe, creamy with an oxidative character from the wood aging that adds an extra dimension to the crisp fruit. It is spicy, mineral and will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Niepoort 2015 Vertente Red (Douro)
description: This fruit-driven, ripe wine is also balanced. Full of black fruits and with elegance and poise, it is a wine for drinking early. Fruitiness and the touch of minerality and concentration from the old vines in the blend give both texture and crispness. Drink now.

title: Ponzi 2015 Aurora Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: The nose brings suggestions of rum, hazelnuts and cocoa; in the mouth the wine is deep and delicious. Brambly berries are mixed with well-integrated barrel flavors of toasted nuts. The wine was aged in half new French oak for 20 months.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This wine, a field blend from old vines, is beautifully textured. It is made in a sweet, perfumed style, with dried fruits and prune flavors. Acidity does appear and gives the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of this wine is the opulent character. Drink now.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Radford Dale 2015 The Renaissance of Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Scents of honeysuckle, beeswax, baked apple and whole spice lead the nose of this attractive white. The palate showcases a goregeous balance between ripe fruit tones, well-integrated spice and ample acidity, with a gravely texture that lends length to the close. Final notes of woodspice and citrus pith leave you ready for more. Drink now–2024.
